data.enText: to take an organ, skin, etc. from one person, animal, part of the body, etc. and put it into or onto another

data.chText: 外科医生成功地给一个四岁的男孩移植了肝脏。
data.enText: Surgeons have successfully transplanted a liver into a four-year-old boy.

data.chText: 患者经常排斥移植的器官。

data.enText: to move a growing plant and plant it somewhere else
to move sb/sth to a different place or environment

data.chText: 日本的生产方法已被引进到一些英国的工厂。
data.enText: Japanese production methods have been transplanted into some British factories.

data.chText: 整个社群向海外的迁移
data.enText: the transplantation of entire communities overseas
a medical operation in which a damaged organ, etc. is replaced with one from another person

data.chText: 适合移植的肾脏的短缺
data.enText: a shortage of suitable kidneys for transplant
an organ, etc. that is used in a transplant operation

data.chText: 身体总是有排斥移植器官的可能。
data.enText: There is always a chance that the body will reject the transplant.

simple_means.memory_skill: trans 转移 + plant 种植；植物 → 移往别处 → 移植

tr: the act of removing something from one location and introducing it in another location
example: the transplant did not flower until the second year
too frequent transplanting is not good for families
she returned to Alabama because she could not bear transplantation

tr: an operation moving an organ from one organism (the donor) to another (the recipient)
example: the long-term results of cardiac transplantation are now excellent
a child had a multiple organ transplant two months ago

tr: (surgery) tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient
in some cases the patient can be both donor and recipient
transfer from one place or period to another
example: The ancient Greek story was transplanted into Modern America

tr: place the organ of a donor into the body of a recipient
lift and reset in another soil or situation

example: These delicate plants do not transplant easily

value.boxr_value: The noun is pronounced /'trænsplɑːnt, -plænt/. The verb is pronounced /træns'plɑːnt, -'plænt/. 名词读作 /'trænsplɑːnt, -plænt/。动词读作 /træns'plɑːnt, -'plænt/。

value.def: A transplant is a medical operation in which a part of a person's body is replaced because it is diseased.

example.ex: He was recovering from a heart transplant operation.
example.tran: 他做了心脏移植手术，正在康复。

example.ex: ...the controversy over the sale of human organs for transplant.
example.tran: 出售移植用人体器官引起的争议

value.def: If doctors transplant an organ such as a heart or a kidney, they use it to replace a patient's diseased organ.

example.ex: The operation to transplant a kidney is now fairly routine.
example.tran: 肾脏移植手术如今已相当常见。

example.ex: ...transplanted organs such as hearts and kidneys.
example.tran: 类似心脏、肾脏这样的移植器官

example.ex: Bone marrow transplantation began 20 years ago.
example.tran: 骨髓移植开始于 20 年前。

value.def: To transplant someone or something means to move them to a different place.

example.ex: Marriage had transplanted Rebecca from London to Manchester...
example.tran: 因为结婚，丽贝卡从伦敦移居到了曼彻斯特。

example.ex: In the 19th century, the Santa Claus tradition seems to have been transplanted back to Europe…
example.tran: 19 世纪，圣诞老人的习俗似乎又传回了欧洲。

example.ex: Farmers will be able to seed it directly, rather than having to transplant seedlings.
example.tran: 农民将能够直接播种，而不用移种秧苗。

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to plant, plant 种植；植物
rootsaffixes.title: plant

partsOfSpeech.dec: plant 种植；植物 + able 可…的 → 可以种植的
plant 种植；植物 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 种植植物〔的地方〕； 种〔树〕→ 大农场；造林
im 进入 + plant 种植；植物 → 种进去 → 插入
re 重新 + plant 种植；植物 → 再植
sup 下 + plant 种植；植物 → 在下面种上东西把上面的取代掉 → 取代
trans 转移 + plant 种植；植物 → 移往别处 → 移植
trans 转移 + plant 种植；植物 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 移植
trans 横过，越过 + atlantic 大西洋的 → 横渡大西洋的
tran 横过，越过 + scend 爬 → 爬越〔障碍〕→ 超越
trans 横过，越过 + contienent 大陆 + al …的 → 横贯大陆的
tran 横过，越过 + sect 切 → 横切，横断
trans 横过，越过 + frontier 国境 → 在国境外的
trans 横过，越过 + gress 走 → 走过界 → 冒犯
trans 横过，越过 + luc 光 + ent 具有…性质的 → 光可穿过的 → 半透明的
trans 横过，越过 + national 国家的 → 超越国界的
trans 横过，越过 + normal 正常的 → 超出常规的
trans 横过，越过 + ocean 海洋 + ic …的 → 横越海洋的
trans 横过，越过 + par 看见 + ent 具有…性质的 → 可以看穿的 → 透明的
trans 横过，越过 + personal 个人的 → 超越个人的
trans 变换，转移 + action 行动 → 交换行动 → 交易
trans 变换，转移 + code 代码 → 转换代码
trans 变换，转移 + scrib 写 + e → 写到别的地方 → 抄写
trans 变换，转移 + fer 带来 → 转送，转移
trans 变换，转移 + figure 形状 → 改观；变形
trans 变换，转移 + form 形状 → 变形；改造
trans 变换，转移 + fus 流 + e → 让〔血〕转移 → 输血
trans 变换，转移 + it 走 → 运输，载运
trans 变换，转移 + it 走 + ory …的 → 走过就变的 → 短暂的
trans 变换，转移 + migrate 移居 → 移居
trans 变换，转移 + mit 送 → 寄送；传达
trans 变换，转移 + mut 改变 + e → 变过去 → 使变形
trans 变换，转移 + plant 种植 → 移植
trans 变换，转移 + port 运 → 运输
trans 变换，转移 + pos 放 + e → 变换位置
trans 变换，转移 + ship 船 → 换船
trans 变换，转移 + vest 衣服 + ite 表人 → 变换〔男女〕衣服风格的人 → 有异性装扮癖好的人
